title: After the Romans crushed the Eburones

content.description:
Ambiorix thwarts the Romans.

1 At barbaris consilium non defuit. Nam duces eorum

tota acie pronuntiare iusserunt, ne quis ab loco

discederet: illorum esse praedam atque illis reservari

quaecumque Romani reliquissent: proinde omnia in

5 victoria posita existimarent. Erant et virtute et studio

pugnandi pares; nostri, tametsi ab duce et a fortuna

deserebantur, tamen omnem spem salutis in virtute

ponebant, et quotiens quaeque cohors procurrerat,

ab ea parte magnus numerus hostium cadebat.

10 Qua re animadversa Ambiorix pronuntiari iubet, ut

procul tela coniciant neu propius accedant et, quam

in partem Romani impetum fecerint, cedant; levitate

armorum et cotidiana exercitatione nihil eis noceri

posse, rursus se ad signa recipientes insequantur.
content.question: After the Romans crushed the revolt of the Eburones, their leader Ambiorix

choices.label: poisoned himself since he was too old to flee
crossed the Rhine and was never seen again
was paraded in Caesar’s triumphal procession in Rome
was assassinated by his own people since he was favored by Caesar

content.answer: crossed the Rhine and was never seen again

skill.text: 2.B: Describe historical and cultural contexts of Latin texts.
